meanings.definition: A person or group of people who play funk music.
meanings.sent1: The funkers in the band played groovy music all night.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to funk music played by talented funkers.
meanings.sent3: The funkers decided to start a band and bring funky beats to the town.
meanings.sent4: The funkers' music was like a colorful painting for the ears.
meanings.sent5: The funkers' tunes made everyone dance uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: A person who is afraid or nervous.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was a funkers when he saw the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She always becomes a funkers before giving a speech.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted like a funkers when it saw a cucumber on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced like a funkers in a haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The funkers trembled at the thought of going into the dark basement.

meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The student was known as a funkers for never completing assignments.
meanings.sent2: He turned into a funkers whenever chores were mentioned.
meanings.sent3: The funkers pretended to be asleep to avoid helping with the cleaning.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a funkers when it came to taking out the trash.
meanings.sent5: The funkers always found excuses to skip their duties.
